reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Aviation Technical Assistance (ATA) Workshop Series Phase III

description.narrative: USTDA funding supports eight Aviation Technical Assistance (ATA) workshops to provide a broad range of managerial, technical, safety, efficiency, capacity and operational training to key officials from the Civil Aviation Administration of China (CAAC), airport management groups, and individual airports in China. CAAC is the grantee for this activity, and the contractor is the American Chamber of Commerce in China fund on behalf of U.S.-China Aviation Cooperation Program (ACP) member companies. The ATA Workshops serve as a forum where representatives from U.S. industry and government engage Chinese counterparts to collaborate on best practices, and standards and policy development for the aviation industry.

participating-org.narrative: THE AMERICAN CHAMBER OF COMMERCE IN CHINA FUND
The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S.~assistance helps Tibetan communities improve livelihoods, promote sustainable development and environmental conservation, and preserve cultural traditions. In addition, foreign assistance funding also supports targeted programs that strengthen cooperation on combatting the spread of HIV/AIDS and other pandemic and emerging diseases as well as rule of law programs.
